TEXT: e1: The state ought not to restrict medical products or medical treatments for moral reasons as long as they don't do damage to others.
CN RELATION: medical products, damage (NotCauses)/treatments, damage (NotCauses)/state, restrict medical products (NotCapableOf)/state, restrict medical treatments (NotCapableOf)/restrict medical products, do damage to others (HasPrerequisite)/restrict medical treatments, do damage to others (HasPrerequisite)/state, moral reasons (HasA)

TEXT: e2: But without a prescription requirement there's also no medical advice given before intake.
CN RELATION: no prescription requirement, no medical advice (Causes)/prescription requirement, medical advice given before intake (Causes)/prescription, medical advice (HasPrerequisite)

TEXT: e3: Since the impact of the morning-after pill is so massive, particularly due to its abortive effect,
CN RELATION: morning-after pill, massive impact (HasA)/morning-after pill, abortive effect (HasA)/abortive effect, massive impact (Causes)

TEXT: e4: dispensing it without medical advice would be inappropriate.
CN RELATION: morning-after pill, dispensed without medical advice (ReceivesAction)/dispensing of morning-after pill without medical advice, inappropriate (HasProperty)

TEXT: e5: Easy access to the morning-after pill could also result in its appearing to be an easier method than other forms of contraception that, however, have fewer health effects.
CN RELATION: morning-after pill, easily accessed (HasProperty)/contraception, health effects (HasA)/easy access to the morning-after pill, appearing to be an easier method than other forms of contraception (Causes)

TEXT: e6: For instance the morning-after pill could result in a decrease in the use of condoms and thus lead to an increase in new infections with Aids.
CN RELATION: morning-after pill, decrease in the use of condoms (Causes)/decrease in the use of condoms, increase in new infections with Aids (Causes)
